title: Both the Johnson Government and the EU now appear ready to roll dice on general election before Christmas
text:
In truth it was a miracle that the eyeballing contest that has been going on the last few weeks between Downing Street and Michel Barnier’s negotiating team continued for as long as it did before breaking out into the diplomatic equivalent of a bar-room brawl on Wednesday.

Number Ten arguably threw the first punch with a hostile briefing of a private phone call between Boris Johnson and the German Chancellor Angela Merkel, but with the EU side also not averse to hostile briefings, frustrations were always likely to boil over one way or another.

Ever since Downing Street put its new Brexit proposals on the table a week ago it has been abundantly clear that there was no obvious way to reconcile...
description: In truth it was a miracle that the eyeballing contest that has been going on the last few weeks between Downing Street and Michel Barnier’s negotiating team continued for as long as it did before breaking out into the diplomatic equivalent of a bar-room brawl on Wednesday.
